info.name: Schema Registry API
info.description:
The Schema Registry API is used to access the Schema Library within Adobe Experience Platform. The registry provides a user interface and RESTful API from which all available library resources are accessible.

Related Documentation:

  • XDM System in Adobe Experience Platform
  • Basics of Schema Composition
  • Schema Registry API Developer Guide
  • Schema Registry API Tutorial

Notes:

  • PLATFORM Gateway URL: https://platform.adobe.io
  • Base path for this API: /data/foundation/schemaregistry
  • Example of a complete path for making a call to "/stats": https://platform.adobe.io/data/foundation/schemaregistry/stats

item.name: Stats
Return {TENANT_ID} and Schema Registry usage information.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

item.description: Returns {TENANT_ID} along with information regarding IMS Org usage of the Schema Registry such as resource counts, recently created resources, and class usage.

item.name: Schemas
List all schemas within the specified container.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
The desired response format (eg. application/vnd.adobe.xed-id+json). Do not include "version".
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

request.description:
You are able to view a list of all schemas within a container by performing a single GET request. To help filter results, the Schema Registry supports the use of query parameters when listing resources. The most common query parameters include:

  • limit - Limit the number of resources returned. e.g. limit=5 will return only five resources in the list.
  • orderby - Sort results by a specific property. e.g. orderby=title will sort results by title ascending (A-Z). Adding a - before title (orderby=-title) will sort items by title descending (Z-A).
  • properties - Filter results on any top-level attributes. e.g. property=meta:intendedToExtend==https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/context/profile returns only mixins that are compatible with the Profile class.
  • You may also use an ampersand (&) to combine query parameters.

The response format depends on the Accept header sent in the request. The following Accept headers are available for this request:

  • application/vnd.adobe.xed-id+json | Returns a short summary of each resource, generally the preferred header for listing.
  • application/vnd.adobe.xed-full+json | Returns full JSON for each resource, with original $ref and allOf attributes included.

item.name: Create a new tenant-defined schema.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
Type of content being sent in the body of the request (eg. application/json)
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

item.name: Lookup a specific schema by its unique ID.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
The desired response format (eg. application/vnd.adobe.xed-full+json; version=1). "Version" is required.
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

request.description:
The response format depends on the Accept header sent in the request. The following Accept headers are available for this request:

  • application/vnd.adobe.xed+json; version={major version} Raw with $ref and allOf, has titles, descriptions
  • application/vnd.adobe.xed-full+json; version={major version} $refs and allOf resolved, has titles and descriptions
  • application/vnd.adobe.xed-notext+json; version={major version} Raw with $ref and allOf, no titles or descriptions
  • application/vnd.adobe.xed-full-notext+json; version={major version} $refs and allOf resolved, no titles or descriptions
  • application/vnd.adobe.xed-full-desc+json; version={major version} $refs and allOf resolved, descriptors included


A lookup request requires the resource 'major version' be included in the Accept header. When supplying the major version, the registry returns the latest minor version automatically.

item.name: Replace a tenant-defined schema.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
Type of content being sent in the body of the request (eg. application/json)
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

request.description: A PUT request essentially re-writes the schema, therefore the request body must include all fields required to create (POST) a schema. This is especially useful when updating a lot of information in the schema at once.

item.name: Modify or update part of a tenant-defined schema.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
Type of content being sent in the body of the request (eg. application/json)
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

request.description:
The Schema Registry supports all standard JSON Patch operations, including add, remove, and replace, to allow users to modify or update schemas they have defined.


For more informatiom on JSON Patch, including all available operations, read the official JSON Patch documentation (http://jsonpatch.com/).

item.name: Remove a tenant-defined schema from the registry.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

request.description:
Remove an existing schema by performing a DELETE request to the $id of the schema being removed.


A successful deletion returns an empty response body and HTTP Status Code 204 (No-content).

item.description: Schemas provide an abstract definition of a real-world object along with constraints and expectations that can be applied and used to validate data.

item.name: Remove a tenant-defined data type from the registry.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

request.description:
Removing a data type is done through a DELETE request to the $id of the data type being removed.


A successful deletion returns an empty response body and HTTP Status Code 204 (No-content).

item.description: Data types are used as reference field types in classes or schemas to define complex types. Data types may define multiple sub-fields providing a consistent multi-field structure.

item.name: Descriptors
List all descriptors within the specified container, by type.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
Descriptors require unique Accept headers using 'xdm' instead of 'xed' (eg. application/vnd.adobe.xdm-id+json)
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

request.description:
Schemas define a static view of data entities, but do not provide specific details on how data based on these schemas (datasets, etc) may relate to one another. Adobe Experience Platform allows you to describe these relationships and other interpretive metadata about a schema using descriptors.


Schema descriptors are tenant-level metadata, meaning they are unique to your IMS Organization and all descriptor operations take place in the tenant container.


Each schema can have one or more schema descriptor entities applied to it. Each schema descriptor entity includes a descriptor '@type' and the 'sourceSchema' to which it applies. Once applied, these descriptors will apply to all datasets created using the schema.


The Schema Registry supports the use of query parameters when listing descriptors. The most common query parameters include:

  • property - Return only results that match the given property. e.g. property=@type==xdm:descriptorIdentity returns only descriptors with a '@type' of 'xdm:descriptorIdentity'.
  • limit - Limit the number of resources returned. e.g. limit=5 will return only five resources in the list.
  • You may also use an ampersand (&) to combine query parameters.

Accept headers for descriptors include:

  • application/vnd.adobe.xdm-id+json | Returns an array of descriptor IDs
  • application/vnd.adobe.xdm-link+json | Returns an array of descriptor API paths
  • application/vnd.adobe.xdm-full+json | Returns an array of expanded descriptor objects

item.name: Create a new descriptor. Required fields in payload vary based on @type.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
Type of content being sent in the body of the request (eg. application/json)
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

request.description: Required fields for defining a descriptor vary based on the @type of the descriptor.

item.name: Lookup specific descriptor by its @id.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

request.description: View the details of a specific descriptor by performing a lookup (GET) request using the @id of the descriptor. Descriptors are not versioned, therefore no Accept header is required in the lookup request.

item.name: Update a descriptor. Required fields in payload vary based on @type.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
Type of content being sent in the body of the request (eg. application/json)
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

request.description:
Update a desriptor by issuing a PUT request to the @id of the descriptor being updated.

This action is re-writing the existing descriptor, therefore the payload must include all descriptor fields that were required when the descriptor was defined.

item.name: Remove a descriptor using its @id.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

request.description: Remove a descriptor from the registry by issuing a DELETE request to the @id of the descriptor being removed.

item.description: Schema descriptors are tenant-level metadata used to provide interpretive details on how data based on certain schemas may relate or interact with one another.

item.name: Unions
Retrieve a list of union views.

header.description: The desired response format (eg. application/vnd.adobe.xed-id+json). Do not include "version".
The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

item.name: Lookup a union view by ID.

header.description: The access token provided after authorization in the format "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}"
Your specific API key for your unique Platform configuration ({API_KEY})
Unique Identifier for your IMS Organization ({IMS_ORG})
The desired response format (eg. application/vnd.adobe.xed-full+json; version=1). "Version" is required.
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'

item.description: Union views aggregate the fields of all schemas that implement the same class (such as ExperienceEvent or Profile) into a single schema. They are used by Real-time Customer Profile to merge data together to form a "single source of truth" for an individual.
